name: TownePlace Suites Burlington Williston

reviews.title: Thin walls, barking dogs
reviews.text: The first night, we listened to the guy in the room next door talk on his cell phone until 1AM. The second night, someone went out to dinner and left their barking dogs behind. Bring earplugs.

reviews.title: Great place for long term stay
reviews.text: I went to a seminar class in Vermont and stayed at the towneplace suites in Williston for 2 weeks. The staff is EXTREMELY friendly and courteous. I had the studio suite. It had a full size kitchen queen size bed, sofa couch with pull out bed, full enclosed bathroom, sink not outside of bathroom like some other hotels. Free wireless internet, but weak signal. You can program your telephone for wakeup calls. TV has alot of station, and I mean alot. My room was facing the open field and was quiet. AC is controlled by thermostat. Hotel is located very near, walking distance to a very big supermarket "Shaw's", Best Buy, Staples, Home Depot, Marshalls, Toys R Us, Bed Bath and Beyond, movie theatres, Longhorn restaurant, Chili's and much, much more. Very close to onramp to I89. There is a small swimming pool and gym room. I did not have time to utilize any of those facilities. Hotel is close to downtown Burlington and the airport. I had no problems with parking. Overall, I felt like I was home. I would stay here again at the drop of the hat if I had to go back to Vermont.

We checked in on a Thursday night and were welcomed with fresh coffee and brownies. We were a little dissapointed to find out our room (located in the NON smoking building) was in another building from the pool, which by the way does not have a hot tub.
reviews.title: Nice place to stay
like a little apartment
reviews.text: When we got to the room we found it clean and comfortable, but a little small. We had recently stayed at a Residence Inn 1 bedroom and found that our 2 bedroom at the TownePlace Suites was about the same size but 2 bedrooms. The kitchen was small but very clean. When making breakfast (eggs and bacon) in the morning it was hard to modulate the temp on the stove so the smoke detectors kept going off. Thank goodness for windows! We had to fan the smoke away from the smoke detectors and out the windows. This of course gave the kids plenty to talk about - Mom trying to burn down the hotel.
Aside from the smoke -filled room, the barking dogs and the absence of a working toilet, the place was okay....
reviews.title: Lots of problems

likes.disliked: — no working toilet and no one to fix it

reviews.text: The over-flowing garbage bags by the front foor should have clued me in, but I ventured forth, anyway, since it was hard to get a room in Burlington, VT on this particular June weekend. Pleased to see several signs announcing: "this entire facility is non-smoking." Checked in very efficiently by the only clerk on duty -- a very pleasant young woman who'd been on the job less than a month.
reviews.title: Excellent Customer service, quiet surroundings, smoky rooms

likes.liked: — Cusmoer service and the friendliness of desk staff
likes.disliked: — our room reeked of smoke and air freshener

reviews.text: Opened the door to the room and were greeted with the over-powering stench of cigarette smoke. Sitting on the table was a large green metal contraption - labelled AIR CLEANER - but it was not plugged in. And if it had been plugged in at some point, it wasn't very effective. The bathroom fan was on, but that wasn't doing a thing to get rid of the smoke.
reviews.title: A good place to sleep

likes.disliked: — The hotel is in located in (and is contributing to) Burlington's urban sprawl.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Back to the front desk where, once again, our efficient (but quite overworked) clerk assigns us a new room. We get to the room and discover it's being cleaned. Housekeeper promises 20 minutes. 45 minutes later, we're in the room. Nice, clean room, though a bit heavy handed on the air freshener. We open the windows and go to dinner at the place recommended by our desk clerk. Restaurant doesn't exist, at least not in the location she described, but there were plenty of other options.
reviews.title: Great place to stay

likes.disliked: — Location is a bit out of the way.

reviews.title: A great place! Clean, quiet
reviews.text: Get back at 10 and discover the toilet doesn't work. I call the front desk and she says, "oh, dear, well we don't have any service people; sorry about that" Okay. I check out all the usual things that could make a toilet malfunction - to no avail. Go to the front desk to ask if they have a plunger and the desk clerk says cheerily: "oh, didn't you see the plunger right there next to the toilet?" I probably would have noticed a plunger propped up next to the fresh towels. Back to the room and I did, indeed, find the plunger under the sink. Still wet. Again, not a good sign. I commence plunging. Toilet seems to lack water. Won't flush or fill. As I'm laboring over the toilet, the phone rings and I run to the bedroom plunger in hand. As I stand there talking to her, with a dripping plunber, it occurs to me that this is not the way hotel service should be. She offers to give us the room for half price. "Half-price!!??!! There's no toilet" I begin to lose my temper. Hey, can you blame me?

We just stayed in a cozy little efficiency room here for a family gathering a few weeks ago. The rooms are very clean and they are actually upgrading the place as we were there. They are painting all the halls and i heard there were some room upgrades going as well. Very convenient to Burlington and all the shops in Williston. The front desk staff was very friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Nice Place, New Upgrades

likes.liked: — Clean, Full Kitchen, Convenient to Burlington

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall a good stay, totally recommended to anyone going to the Burlington area for leisure or business.
reviews.title: Wonderful

reviews.text: Best price in Burlington and well worth the money. Very nice rooms, friendly staff, clean, nice kitchens. What more could you want. Couldn't find an elevator though.
reviews.title: wonderful staff!

likes.liked: — the condo like feel instead of just 1 room

reviews.text: We stayed at this property while my husband worked in the area. We found it to be very comfortable and the staff is way above par. We had a 2 bedroom unit and were quite pleased with it. The apartment was clean and well maintained. The pool and fitness room is open 24 hours a day which is a nice change as people work very different schedules and can use the facilities anytime day or night. The kitchen is a great option for those of us who do not like to run out first thing in the morning or prefer a home cooked meal. The location is great for doing and seeing many of the attractions the area has to offer. It is close to downtown Burlington without the high price tag of the waterfront hotels. I cannot say enough good things about the front desk staff, they are friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Below average AND - watch out for construction!!!!

reviews.text: I booked this as a reward, so I won't comment on price.
reviews.title: disappointing stay

aka: Towneplace Suites Burlington Williston Hotel Williston
description: TownePlace Suites, Burlington Williston has the areas newest long term stay suites. We are just minutes to Burlington, The University of Vermont, IBM, General Dynamics, and many more Vermont businesses and attractions. A top to bottom room renovation was completed in 2013. Our renovation includes, new beds and bedding, new kitchens with granite counter tops, 40" flat screen TV's, a brand new breakfast room, and and new large stone patio area complete with soft seating, tables, chairs, BBQ grill and fire pits. Our warm and inviting staff will make sure you have a comforatbale and relaxing stay.
